Class Competition

java.lang.Object
Competition
All Implemented Interfaces:
Subject
public class Competition
extends java.lang.Object
implements Subject
The Competition Class is used in and Observer design pattern as a Subject, and the registered teams play the role of the Observers. The primary information consists of the type and gender of the competition, a list with all the registered teams, the number of teams and a ranking function, which simplifies
Author:
Bogdan - Andrei Buga, 322CB

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Competition​(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String gender)
    Builds a new competition with the type and gender specified as parameters; the default number of teams is 0.

    void notifyObservers()
    Updates each team about all the changes after a match.
    void playAllMatches()
    Sets the points of all teams after playing all the possible matches no more than once.
    void playMatch​(int i, int j)
    Compares the scores of two teams whose index in the team list are given as parameters and, based on the score differnce, adds points to either jsut one team or both.
    void printAllTeamsWithRank​(java.io.PrintWriter print_writer)
    Prints the names of all teams by the order they have been registered in the competition, along with their ranks at the end of the competition.
    void printFirstThreeTeams​(java.io.PrintWriter print_writer)
    Prints the names of first three ranked teams with a given PrintWriter.
    java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> ranking()
    Returns a ranking system where the rank and the name of each team is remembered as a HashMap.

    Registers (adds) a new team (Observer) in the competition only if it has the required type and gender.

    • Competition

      public Competition​(java.lang.String type, java.lang.String gender)
      Builds a new competition with the type and gender specified as parameters; the default number of teams is 0.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of the competition;
      gender - the gender of the players.

    • ranking

      public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,​java.lang.String> ranking()
      Returns a ranking system where the rank and the name of each team is remembered as a HashMap.
      Returns:
      a HashMap function with Integer keys from 1 to the number of teams and String values which represent the names of the teams.

    • register

      public void register​(Observer o)
      Registers (adds) a new team (Observer) in the competition only if it has the required type and gender.
      Specified by:
      register in interface Subject
      Parameters:
      o - the observer team to be added;

    • notifyObservers

      public void notifyObservers()
      Updates each team about all the changes after a match.
      Specified by:
      notifyObservers in interface Subject

    • playMatch

      public void playMatch​(int i, int j)
      Compares the scores of two teams whose index in the team list are given as parameters and, based on the score differnce, adds points to either jsut one team or both. Once the points have been added, if necesary, all teams will have their rank updated by calling the notifyObservers() method.
      Parameters:
      i - the index of the host team;
      j - the index of the guest team.

    • playAllMatches

      public void playAllMatches()
      Sets the points of all teams after playing all the possible matches no more than once.

    • printFirstThreeTeams

      public void printFirstThreeTeams​(java.io.PrintWriter print_writer)
      Prints the names of first three ranked teams with a given PrintWriter.
      Parameters:
      print_writer - the destination file to write the result mentioned in the description.

    • printAllTeamsWithRank

      public void printAllTeamsWithRank​(java.io.PrintWriter print_writer)
      Prints the names of all teams by the order they have been registered in the competition, along with their ranks at the end of the competition.
      Parameters:
      print_writer - the destination file to write the result mentioned in the description.
